member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CustomAttributesBag`1
member.summary: Represents a bag of custom attributes and the associated decoded well-known attribute data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CustomAttributesBag`1.Empty
member.summary: Instance representing sealed custom attribute bag with no attributes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CustomAttributesBag`1.WithEmptyData
member.summary: Returns a non-sealed custom attribute bag with null initialized , null initialized and uninitialized .

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CustomAttributesBag`1.SetEarlyDecodedWellKnownAttributeData(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.EarlyWellKnownAttributeData)
member.summary: Sets the early decoded well-known attribute data on the bag in a thread safe manner. Stored early decoded data is immutable and cannot be updated further.
member.returns: Returns true if early decoded data were stored into the bag on this thread.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CustomAttributesBag`1.SetDecodedWellKnownAttributeData(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.WellKnownAttributeData)
member.summary: Sets the decoded well-known attribute data (except the early data) on the bag in a thread safe manner. Stored decoded data is immutable and cannot be updated further.
member.returns: Returns true if decoded data were stored into the bag on this thread.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CustomAttributesBag`1.SetAttributes(System.Collections.Immutable.ImmutableArray{`0})
member.summary: Sets the bound attributes on the bag in a thread safe manner. If store succeeds, it seals the bag and makes the bag immutable.
member.returns: Returns true if bound attributes were stored into the bag on this thread.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CustomAttributesBag`1.Attributes
member.summary: Gets the stored bound attributes in the bag.
member.remarks: This property can only be accessed on a sealed bag.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CustomAttributesBag`1.DecodedWellKnownAttributeData
member.summary: Gets the decoded well-known attribute data (except the early data) in the bag.
member.remarks: This property can only be accessed on the bag after has been invoked.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CustomAttributesBag`1.EarlyDecodedWellKnownAttributeData
member.summary: Gets the early decoded well-known attribute data in the bag.
member.remarks: This property can only be accessed on the bag after has been invoked.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CustomAttributesBag`1.IsEarlyDecodedWellKnownAttributeDataComputed
member.summary: Return whether early decoded attribute data has been computed and stored on the bag and it is safe to access from this bag. Return value of true doesn't guarantee that bound attributes or remaining decoded attribute data has also been initialized.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CustomAttributesBag`1.IsDecodedWellKnownAttributeDataComputed
member.summary: Return whether all decoded attribute data has been computed and stored on the bag and it is safe to access from this bag. Return value of true doesn't guarantee that bound attributes have also been initialized.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CustomAttributesBag`1.CustomAttributeBagCompletionPart
member.summary: Enum representing the current state of attribute binding/decoding for a corresponding CustomAttributeBag.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CustomAttributesBag`1.CustomAttributeBagCompletionPart.None
member.summary: Bag has been created, but no decoded data or attributes have been stored. CustomAttributeBag is in this state during early decoding phase.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CustomAttributesBag`1.CustomAttributeBagCompletionPart.EarlyDecodedWellKnownAttributeData
member.summary: Early decoded attribute data has been computed and stored on the bag, but bound attributes or remaining decoded attribute data is not stored. Only can be accessed from this bag.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CustomAttributesBag`1.CustomAttributeBagCompletionPart.DecodedWellKnownAttributeData
member.summary: All decoded attribute data has been computed and stored on the bag, but bound attributes are not yet stored. Both and can be accessed from this bag.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CustomAttributesBag`1.CustomAttributeBagCompletionPart.Attributes
member.summary: Bound attributes have been computed and stored on this bag.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.CustomAttributesBag`1.CustomAttributeBagCompletionPart.All
member.summary: CustomAttributeBag is completely initialized and immutable.

member.summary: True if the assembly contains interactive code.

member.summary: Gets the name of this assembly.

member.summary: Gets the merged root namespace that contains all namespaces and types defined in the modules of this assembly. If there is just one module in this assembly, this property just returns the GlobalNamespace of that module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IAssemblySymbol.Modules
member.summary: Gets the modules in this assembly. (There must be at least one.) The first one is the main module that holds the assembly manifest.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IAssemblySymbol.TypeNames
member.summary: Gets the set of type identifiers from this assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IAssemblySymbol.NamespaceNames
member.summary: Gets the set of namespace names from this assembly.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IAssemblySymbol.GivesAccessTo(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IAssemblySymbol)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this assembly gives access to internal symbols

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IAssemblySymbol.GetTypeByMetadataName(System.String)
member.summary: Lookup a type within the assembly using the canonical CLR metadata name of the type.
member.param: Type name.
member.returns: Symbol for the type or null if type cannot be found or is ambiguous.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IAssemblySymbol.MightContainExtensionMethods
member.summary: Determines if the assembly might contain extension methods. If false, the assembly does not contain extension methods.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IAssemblySymbol.ResolveForwardedType(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the type symbol for a forwarded type based its canonical CLR metadata name. The name should refer to a non-nested type. If type with this name is not forwarded, null is returned.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IDynamicTypeSymbol
member.summary: Represents the 'dynamic' type in C#.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IErrorTypeSymbol
member.summary: An IErrorTypeSymbol is used when the compiler cannot determine a symbol object to return because of an error. For example, if a field is declared "Foo x;", and the type "Foo" cannot be found, an IErrorTypeSymbol is returned when asking the field "x" what it's type is.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IErrorTypeSymbol.CandidateSymbols
member.summary: When constructing this type, there may have been symbols that seemed to be what the user intended, but were unsuitable. For example, a type might have been inaccessible, or ambiguous. This property returns the possible symbols that the user might have intended. It will return no symbols if no possible symbols were found. See the CandidateReason property to understand why the symbols were unsuitable.
member.remarks: This only applies if this INamedTypeSymbol has TypeKind TypeKind.Error. If not, an empty ImmutableArray is returned.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IErrorTypeSymbol.CandidateReason
member.summary: If CandidateSymbols returns one or more symbols, returns the reason that those symbols were not chosen. Otherwise, returns None.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IEventSymbol
member.summary: Represents an event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IEventSymbol.Type
member.summary: The type of the event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IEventSymbol.IsWindowsRuntimeEvent
member.summary: Returns true if the event is a WinRT type event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IEventSymbol.AddMethod
member.summary: The 'add' accessor of the event. Null only in error scenarios.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IEventSymbol.RemoveMethod
member.summary: The 'remove' accessor of the event. Null only in error scenarios.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IEventSymbol.RaiseMethod
member.summary: The 'raise' accessor of the event. Null if there is no raise method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IEventSymbol.OriginalDefinition
member.summary: The original definition of the event. If the event is constructed from another symbol by type substitution, OriginalDefinition gets the original symbol, as it was defined in source or metadata.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IEventSymbol.OverriddenEvent
member.summary: Returns the overridden event, or null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IEventSymbol.ExplicitInterfaceImplementations
member.summary: Returns interface properties explicitly implemented by this event.
member.remarks: Properties imported from metadata can explicitly implement more than one event.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IFieldSymbol
member.summary: Represents a field in a class, struct or enum.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IFieldSymbol.AssociatedSymbol
member.summary: If this field serves as a backing variable for an automatically generated property or a field-like event or a Primary Constructor parameter, returns that property/event/parameter. Otherwise returns null. Note, the set of possible associated symbols might be expanded in the future to reflect changes in the languages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IFieldSymbol.IsConst
member.summary: Returns true if this field was declared as "const" (i.e. is a constant declaration). Also returns true for an enum member.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IFieldSymbol.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Returns true if this field was declared as "readonly".

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IFieldSymbol.IsVolatile
member.summary: Returns true if this field was declared as "volatile".

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IFieldSymbol.Type
member.summary: Gets the type of this field.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IFieldSymbol.HasConstantValue
member.summary: Returns false if the field wasn't declared as "const", or constant value was omitted or errorneous. True otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IFieldSymbol.ConstantValue
member.summary: Gets the constant value of this field

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IFieldSymbol.CustomModifiers
member.summary: Gets the list of custom modifiers, if any, associated with the field.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IFieldSymbol.OriginalDefinition
member.summary: Get the original definition of this symbol. If this symbol is derived from another symbol by (say) type substitution, this gets the original symbol, as it was defined in source or metadata.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ILabelSymbol
member.summary: Represents a label in method body

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ILabelSymbol.ContainingMethod
member.summary: Gets the immediately containing of this .

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ILocalSymbol
member.summary: Represents a local variable in method body.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ILocalSymbol.Type
member.summary: Gets the type of this local variable.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ILocalSymbol.IsConst
member.summary: Returns true if this local variable was declared as "const" (i.e. is a constant declaration). Also returns true for an enum member.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ILocalSymbol.HasConstantValue
member.summary: Returns false if the local variable wasn't declared as "const", or constant value was omitted or erroneous. True otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ILocalSymbol.ConstantValue
member.summary: Gets the constant value of this local variable.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol
member.summary: Represents a method or method-like symbol (including constructor, destructor, operator, or property/event accessor).

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.MethodKind
member.summary: Gets what kind of method this is. There are several different kinds of things in the C# language that are represented as methods. This property allow distinguishing those things without having to decode the name of the method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.Arity
member.summary: Returns the arity of this method, or the number of type parameters it takes. A non-generic method has zero arity.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.IsGenericMethod
member.summary: Returns whether this method is generic; i.e., does it have any type parameters?

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.IsExtensionMethod
member.summary: Returns true if this method is an extension method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.IsAsync
member.summary: Returns true if this method is an async method

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.IsVararg
member.summary:
Returns whether this method is using CLI VARARG calling convention. This is used for C-style variable argument lists. This is used extremely rarely in C# code and is represented using the undocumented __arglist keyword.
Note that methods with params on the last parameter are indicated with the IsParams property on ParameterSymbol, and are not represented with this property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.IsCheckedBuiltin
member.summary: Returns whether this built-in operator checks for integer overflow.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.HidesBaseMethodsByName
member.summary: Returns true if this method hides base methods by name. This cannot be specified directly in the C# language, but can be true for methods defined in other languages imported from metadata. The equivalent of the "hidebyname" flag in metadata.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.ReturnsVoid
member.summary: Returns true if this method has no return type; i.e., returns "void".

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.ReturnType
member.summary: Gets the return type of the method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.TypeArguments
member.summary: Returns the type arguments that have been substituted for the type parameters. If nothing has been substituted for a given type parameter, then the type parameter itself is consider the type argument.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.TypeParameters
member.summary: Get the type parameters on this method. If the method has not generic, returns an empty list.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.Parameters
member.summary: Gets the parameters of this method. If this method has no parameters, returns an empty list.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.ConstructedFrom
member.summary: Returns the method symbol that this method was constructed from. The resulting method symbol has the same containing type (if any), but has type arguments that are the same as the type parameters (although its containing type might not).

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.OriginalDefinition
member.summary: Get the original definition of this symbol. If this symbol is derived from another symbol by (say) type substitution, this gets the original symbol, as it was defined in source or metadata.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.OverriddenMethod
member.summary: If this method overrides another method (because it both had the override modifier and there correctly was a method to override), returns the overridden method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.ReceiverType
member.summary: If this method can be applied to an object, returns the type of object it is applied to.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.ReducedFrom
member.summary: If this method is a reduced extension method, returns the definition of extension method from which this was reduced. Otherwise, returns null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.GetTypeInferredDuringReduction(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeParameterSymbol)
member.summary: If this method is a reduced extension method, returns a type inferred during reduction process for the type parameter.
member.param: Type parameter of the corresponding method.
member.returns: Inferred type or Nothing if nothing was inferred.
member.exception: If this is not a reduced extension method.
If doesn't belong to the corresponding method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.ReduceExtensionMethod(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeSymbol)
member.summary: If this is an extension method that can be applied to a receiver of the given type, returns a reduced extension method symbol thus formed. Otherwise, returns null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.ExplicitInterfaceImplementations
member.summary: Returns interface methods explicitly implemented by this method.
member.remarks: Methods imported from metadata can explicitly implement more than one method, that is why return type is ImmutableArray.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.ReturnTypeCustomModifiers
member.summary: Returns the list of custom modifiers, if any, associated with the returned value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.GetReturnTypeAttributes
member.summary: Returns the list of custom attributes, if any, associated with the returned value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.AssociatedSymbol
member.summary: Returns a symbol (e.g. property, event, etc.) associated with the method.
member.remarks: If this method has of or , returns the property that this method is the getter or setter for. If this method has of or , returns the event that this method is the adder or remover for. Note, the set of possible associated symbols might be expanded in the future to reflect changes in the languages.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.Construct(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeSymbol[])
member.summary: Returns a constructed method given its type arguments.
member.param: The immediate type arguments to be replaced for type parameters in the method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.PartialDefinitionPart
member.summary: If this is a partial method implementation part, returns the corresponding definition part. Otherwise null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.PartialImplementationPart
member.summary: If this is a partial method declaration without a body, and the method is implemented with a body, returns that implementing definition. Otherwise null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.GetDllImportData
member.summary: Platform invoke information, or null if the method isn't a P/Invoke.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol.AssociatedAnonymousDelegate
member.summary:
If this method is a Lambda method (MethodKind = MethodKind.LambdaMethod) and there is an anonymous delegate associated with it, returns this delegate.
Returns null if the symbol is not a lambda or if it does not have an anonymous delegate associated with it.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IModuleSymbol
member.summary: Represents a module within an assembly. Every assembly contains one or more modules.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IModuleSymbol.GlobalNamespace
member.summary: Returns a NamespaceSymbol representing the global (root) namespace, with module extent, that can be used to browse all of the symbols defined in this module.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IModuleSymbol.GetModuleNamespace(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamespaceSymbol)
member.summary: Given a namespace symbol, returns the corresponding module specific namespace symbol

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IModuleSymbol.ReferencedAssemblies
member.summary: Returns an array of assembly identities for assemblies referenced by this module. Items at the same position from ReferencedAssemblies and from ReferencedAssemblySymbols correspond to each other.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IModuleSymbol.ReferencedAssemblySymbols
member.summary: Returns an array of AssemblySymbol objects corresponding to assemblies referenced by this module. Items at the same position from ReferencedAssemblies and from ReferencedAssemblySymbols correspond to each other.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbol
member.summary: Represents a type other than an array, a pointer, a type parameter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbol.Arity
member.summary: Returns the arity of this type, or the number of type parameters it takes. A non-generic type has zero arity.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbol.IsGenericType
member.summary: True if this type or some containing type has type parameters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbol.IsUnboundGenericType
member.summary: True if this is a reference to an unbound generic type. A generic type is considered unbound if all of the type argument lists in its fully qualified name are empty. Note that the type arguments of an unbound generic type will be returned as error types because they do not really have type arguments. An unbound generic type yields null for its BaseType and an empty result for its Interfaces.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbol.IsScriptClass
member.summary: Returns true if the type is a Script class. It might be an interactive submission class or a Script class in a csx file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbol.IsImplicitClass
member.summary: Returns true if the type is the implicit class that holds onto invalid global members (like methods or statements in a non script file).

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbol.MemberNames
member.summary: Returns collection of names of members declared within this type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbol.TypeParameters
member.summary: Returns the type parameters that this type has. If this is a non-generic type, returns an empty ImmutableArray.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbol.TypeArguments
member.summary: Returns the type arguments that have been substituted for the type parameters. If nothing has been substituted for a give type parameters, then the type parameter itself is consider the type argument.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbol.OriginalDefinition
member.summary: Get the original definition of this type symbol. If this symbol is derived from another symbol by (say) type substitution, this gets the original symbol, as it was defined in source or metadata.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbol.DelegateInvokeMethod
member.summary: For delegate types, gets the delegate's invoke method. Returns null on all other kinds of types. Note that is is possible to have an ill-formed delegate type imported from metadata which does not have an Invoke method. Such a type will be classified as a delegate but its DelegateInvokeMethod would be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbol.EnumUnderlyingType
member.summary: For enum types, gets the underlying type. Returns null on all other kinds of types.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbol.ConstructedFrom
member.summary: Returns the type symbol that this type was constructed from. This type symbol has the same containing type (if any), but has type arguments that are the same as the type parameters (although its containing type might not).

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbol.Construct(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeSymbol[])
member.summary: Returns a constructed type given its type arguments.
member.param: The immediate type arguments to be replaced for type parameters in the type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbol.ConstructUnboundGenericType
member.summary: Returns an unbound generic type of this named type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbol.InstanceConstructors
member.summary: Get the instance constructors for this type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbol.StaticConstructors
member.summary: Get the static constructors for this type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbol.Constructors
member.summary: Get the both instance and static constructors for this type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbol.AssociatedSymbol
member.summary: For implicitly declared delegate types returns the EventSymbol that caused this delegate type to be generated. For all other types returns null. Note, the set of possible associated symbols might be expanded in the future to reflect changes in the languages.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbol.MightContainExtensionMethods
member.summary: Determines if the symbol might contain extension methods. If false, the symbol does not contain extension methods.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamespaceOrTypeSymbol
member.summary: Represents either a namespace or a type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamespaceOrTypeSymbol.GetMembers
member.summary: Get all the members of this symbol.
member.returns: An ImmutableArray containing all the members of this symbol. If this symbol has no members, returns an empty ImmutableArray. Never returns Null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamespaceOrTypeSymbol.GetMembers(System.String)
member.summary: Get all the members of this symbol that have a particular name.
member.returns: An ImmutableArray containing all the members of this symbol with the given name. If there are no members with this name, returns an empty ImmutableArray. Never returns Null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamespaceOrTypeSymbol.GetTypeMembers
member.summary: Get all the members of this symbol that are types.
member.returns: An ImmutableArray containing all the types that are members of this symbol. If this symbol has no type members, returns an empty ImmutableArray. Never returns null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamespaceOrTypeSymbol.GetTypeMembers(System.String)
member.summary: Get all the members of this symbol that are types that have a particular name, of any arity.
member.returns: An ImmutableArray containing all the types that are members of this symbol with the given name. If this symbol has no type members with this name, returns an empty ImmutableArray. Never returns null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamespaceOrTypeSymbol.GetTypeMembers(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get all the members of this symbol that are types that have a particular name and arity
member.returns: An ImmutableArray containing all the types that are members of this symbol with the given name and arity. If this symbol has no type members with this name and arity, returns an empty ImmutableArray. Never returns null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamespaceOrTypeSymbol.IsNamespace
member.summary: Returns true if this symbol is a namespace. If it is not a namespace, it must be a type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamespaceOrTypeSymbol.IsType
member.summary: Returns true if this symbols is a type. If it is not a type, it must be a namespace.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamespaceSymbol
member.summary: Represents a namespace.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamespaceSymbol.GetMembers
member.summary: Get all the members of this symbol.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamespaceSymbol.GetMembers(System.String)
member.summary: Get all the members of this symbol that have a particular name.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamespaceSymbol.GetNamespaceMembers
member.summary: Get all the members of this symbol that are namespaces.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamespaceSymbol.IsGlobalNamespace
member.summary: Returns whether this namespace is the unnamed, global namespace that is at the root of all namespaces.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamespaceSymbol.NamespaceKind
member.summary: The kind of namespace: Module, Assembly or Compilation. Module namespaces contain only members from the containing module that share the same namespace name. Assembly namespaces contain members for all modules in the containing assembly that share the same namespace name. Compilation namespaces contain all members, from source or referenced metadata (assemblies and modules) that share the same namespace name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamespaceSymbol.ContainingCompilation
member.summary: The containing compilation for compilation namespaces.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamespaceSymbol.ConstituentNamespaces
member.summary: If a namespace is an assembly or compilation namespace, it may be composed of multiple namespaces that are merged together. If so, ConstituentNamespaces returns all the namespaces that were merged. If this namespace was not merged, returns an array containing only this namespace.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IParameterSymbol
member.summary: Represents a parameter of a method or property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IParameterSymbol.RefKind
member.summary: Whether the parameter passed by value or by reference.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IParameterSymbol.IsParams
member.summary: Returns true if the parameter was declared as a parameter array.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IParameterSymbol.IsOptional
member.summary: Returns true if the parameter is optional.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IParameterSymbol.IsThis
member.summary: Returns true if the parameter is the hidden 'this' ('Me' in Visual Basic) parameter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IParameterSymbol.Type
member.summary: Gets the type of the parameter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IParameterSymbol.CustomModifiers
member.summary: The list of custom modifiers, if any, associated with the parameter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IParameterSymbol.Ordinal
member.summary: Gets the ordinal position of the parameter. The first parameter has ordinal zero. The 'this' parameter ('Me' in Visual Basic) has ordinal -1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IParameterSymbol.HasExplicitDefaultValue
member.summary: Returns true if the parameter specifies a default value to be passed when no value is provided as an argument to a call. The default value can be obtained with the DefaultValue property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IParameterSymbol.ExplicitDefaultValue
member.summary: Returns the default value of the parameter.
member.remarks: Returns null if the parameter type is a struct and the default value of the parameter is the default value of the struct type.
member.exception: The parameter has no default value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IParameterSymbol.OriginalDefinition
member.summary: Get the original definition of this symbol. If this symbol is derived from another symbol by (say) type substitution, this gets the original symbol, as it was defined in source or metadata.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IPointerTypeSymbol
member.summary: Represents a pointer type such as "int *". Pointer types are used only in unsafe code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IPointerTypeSymbol.PointedAtType
member.summary: Gets the type of the storage location that an instance of the pointer type points to.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IPointerTypeSymbol.CustomModifiers
member.summary: The list of custom modifiers, if any, associated with the pointer type. (Some managed languages may represent special information about the pointer type as a custom modifier on either the pointer type or the element type, or both.)

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IPreprocessingSymbol
member.summary: Represents a preprocessing conditional compilation symbol.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IPropertySymbol
member.summary: Represents a property or indexer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IPropertySymbol.IsIndexer
member.summary: Returns whether the property is really an indexer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IPropertySymbol.IsReadOnly
member.summary: True if this is a read-only property; that is, a property with no set accessor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IPropertySymbol.IsWriteOnly
member.summary: True if this is a write-only property; that is, a property with no get accessor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IPropertySymbol.IsWithEvents
member.summary: Returns true if this property is an auto-created WithEvents property that takes place of a field member when the field is marked as WithEvents.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IPropertySymbol.Type
member.summary: The type of the property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IPropertySymbol.Parameters
member.summary: The parameters of this property. If this property has no parameters, returns an empty list. Parameters are only present on indexers, or on some properties imported from a COM interface.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IPropertySymbol.GetMethod
member.summary: The 'get' accessor of the property, or null if the property is write-only.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IPropertySymbol.SetMethod
member.summary: The 'set' accessor of the property, or null if the property is read-only.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IPropertySymbol.OriginalDefinition
member.summary: The original definition of the property. If the property is constructed from another symbol by type substitution, OriginalDefinition gets the original symbol, as it was defined in source or metadata.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IPropertySymbol.OverriddenProperty
member.summary: Returns the overridden property, or null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IPropertySymbol.ExplicitInterfaceImplementations
member.summary: Returns interface properties explicitly implemented by this property.
member.remarks: Properties imported from metadata can explicitly implement more than one property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IPropertySymbol.TypeCustomModifiers
member.summary: The list of custom modifiers, if any, associated with the type of the property.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IRangeVariableSymbol
member.summary: Represents a range variable in a query expression.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol
member.summary: Represents a symbol (namespace, class, method, parameter, etc.) exposed by the compiler.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.Kind
member.summary: Gets the indicating what kind of symbol it is.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.Language
member.summary: Gets the source language ("C#" or "Visual Basic").

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.Name
member.summary: Gets the symbol name. Returns the empty string if unnamed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.MetadataName
member.summary: Gets the name of a symbol as it appears in metadata. Most of the time, this is the same as the Name property, with the following exceptions: 1) The metadata name of generic types includes the "`1", "`2" etc. suffix that indicates the number of type parameters (it does not include, however, names of containing types or namespaces). 2) The metadata name of explicit interface names have spaces removed, compared to the name property. 3) The length of names is limited to not exceed metadata restrictions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.ContainingSymbol
member.summary: Gets the for the immediately containing symbol.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.ContainingAssembly
member.summary: Gets the for the containing assembly. Returns null if the symbol is shared across multiple assemblies.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.ContainingModule
member.summary: Gets the for the containing module. Returns null if the symbol is shared across multiple modules.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.ContainingType
member.summary: Gets the for the containing type. Returns null if the symbol is not contained within a type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.ContainingNamespace
member.summary: Gets the for the nearest enclosing namespace. Returns null if the symbol isn't contained in a namespace.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.IsDefinition
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the symbol is the original definition. Returns false if the symbol is derived from another symbol, by type substitution for instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.IsStatic
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the symbol is static.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.IsVirtual
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the symbol is virtual.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.IsOverride
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the symbol is an override of a base class symbol.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.IsAbstract
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the symbol is abstract.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.IsSealed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the symbol is sealed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.IsExtern
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the symbol is defined externally.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.IsImplicitlyDeclared
member.summary: Returns true if this symbol was automatically created by the compiler, and does not have an explicit corresponding source code declaration.
member.remarks:
This is intended for symbols that are ordinary symbols in the language sense, and may be used by code, but that are simply declared implicitly rather than with explicit language syntax.
Examples include (this list is not exhaustive): the default constructor for a class or struct that is created if one is not provided, the BeginInvoke/Invoke/EndInvoke methods for a delegate, the generated backing field for an auto property or a field-like event, the "this" parameter for non-static methods, the "value" parameter for a property setter, the parameters on indexer accessor methods (not on the indexer itself), methods in anonymous types

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.CanBeReferencedByName
member.summary: Returns true if this symbol can be referenced by its name in code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.Locations
member.summary: Gets the locations where the symbol was originally defined, either in source or metadata. Some symbols (for example, partial classes) may be defined in more than one location.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.DeclaringSyntaxReferences
member.summary:
Get the syntax node(s) where this symbol was declared in source. Some symbols (for example, partial classes) may be defined in more than one location. This property should return one or more syntax nodes only if the symbol was declared in source code and also was not implicitly declared (see the IsImplicitlyDeclared property).
Note that for namespace symbol, the declaring syntax might be declaring a nested namespace. For example, the declaring syntax node for N1 in "namespace N1.N2 {...}" is the entire NamespaceDeclarationSyntax for N1.N2. For the global namespace, the declaring syntax will be the CompilationUnitSyntax.
member.returns: The syntax node(s) that declared the symbol. If the symbol was declared in metadata or was implicitly declared, returns an empty read-only array.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.GetAttributes
member.summary: Gets the attributes for the symbol. Returns an empty if there are no attributes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.DeclaredAccessibility
member.summary: Gets a indicating the declared accessibility for the symbol. Returns NotApplicable if no accessibility is declared.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.OriginalDefinition
member.summary: Gets the for the original definition of the symbol. If this symbol is derived from another symbol, by type substitution for instance, this gets the original symbol, as it was defined in source or metadata.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.GetDocumentationCommentId
member.summary: Returns the Documentation Comment ID for the symbol, or null if the symbol doesn't support documentation comments.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.GetDocumentationCommentXml(System.Globalization.CultureInfo,System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets the XML (as text) for the comment associated with the symbol.
member.param: Preferred culture or null for the default.
Optionally, expand <include> elements. No impact on non-source documentation comments.
Token allowing cancellation of request.
member.returns: The XML that would be written to the documentation file for the symbol.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.ToDisplayString(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SymbolDisplayFormat)
member.summary: Converts the symbol to a string representation.
member.param: Format or null for the default.
member.returns: A formatted string representation of the symbol.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.ToDisplayParts(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SymbolDisplayFormat)
member.summary: Convert a symbol to an array of string parts, each of which has a kind. Useful for colorizing the display string.
member.param: Formatting rules - null implies SymbolDisplayFormat.ErrorMessageFormat.
member.returns: A read-only array of string parts.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.ToMinimalDisplayString(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SemanticModel,System.Int32,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SymbolDisplayFormat)
member.summary: Convert a symbol to a string that can be displayed to the user. May be tailored to a specific location in the source code.
member.param: Binding information (for determining names appropriate to the context).
A position in the source code (context).
Formatting rules - null implies SymbolDisplayFormat.MinimallyQualifiedFormat.
member.returns: A formatted string that can be displayed to the user.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.ToMinimalDisplayParts(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SemanticModel,System.Int32,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SymbolDisplayFormat)
member.summary: Convert a symbol to an array of string parts, each of which has a kind. May be tailored to a specific location in the source code. Useful for colorizing the display string.
member.param: Binding information (for determining names appropriate to the context).
A position in the source code (context).
Formatting rules - null implies SymbolDisplayFormat.MinimallyQualifiedFormat.
member.returns: A read-only array of string parts.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol.HasUnsupportedMetadata
member.summary:
Indicates that this symbol uses metadata that cannot be supported by the language.
Examples include: - Pointer types in VB - ByRef return type - Required custom modifiers
This is distinguished from, for example, references to metadata symbols defined in assemblies that weren't referenced. Symbols where this returns true can never be used successfully, and thus should never appear in any IDE feature.
This is set for metadata symbols, as follows: Type - if a type is unsupported (e.g., a pointer type, etc.) Method - parameter or return type is unsupported Field - type is unsupported Event - type is unsupported Property - type is unsupported Parameter - type is unsupported

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbolExtensions.GetConstructedReducedFrom(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.IMethodSymbol)
member.summary: Returns the constructed form of the ReducedFrom property, including the type arguments that were either inferred during reduction or supplied at the call site.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISynthesizedMethodBodyImplementationSymbol
member.summary: Synthesized symbol that implements a method body feature (iterator, async, lambda, etc.)

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISynthesizedMethodBodyImplementationSymbol.Method
member.summary: The symbol whose body lowering produced this synthesized symbol, or null if the symbol is synthesized based on declaration.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISynthesizedMethodBodyImplementationSymbol.HasMethodBodyDependency
member.summary: True if this symbol body needs to be updated when the body is updated. False if is null.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeParameterSymbol
member.summary: Represents a type parameter in a generic type or generic method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeParameterSymbol.Ordinal
member.summary: The ordinal position of the type parameter in the parameter list which declares it. The first type parameter has ordinal zero.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeParameterSymbol.Variance
member.summary: The variance annotation, if any, of the type parameter declaration. Type parameters may be declared as covariant (out), contravariant (in), or neither.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeParameterSymbol.TypeParameterKind
member.summary: The type parameter kind of this type parameter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeParameterSymbol.DeclaringMethod
member.summary: The method that declares the type parameter, or null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeParameterSymbol.DeclaringType
member.summary: The type that declares the type parameter, or null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeParameterSymbol.HasReferenceTypeConstraint
member.summary: True if the reference type constraint (class) was specified for the type parameter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeParameterSymbol.HasValueTypeConstraint
member.summary: True if the value type constraint (struct)was specified for the type parameter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeParameterSymbol.HasConstructorConstraint
member.summary: True if the parameterless constructor constraint (new()) was specified for the type parameter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeParameterSymbol.ConstraintTypes
member.summary: The types that were directly specified as constraints on the type parameter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeParameterSymbol.OriginalDefinition
member.summary: Get the original definition of this type symbol. If this symbol is derived from another symbol by (say) type substitution, this gets the original symbol, as it was defined in source or metadata.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeParameterSymbol.ReducedFrom
member.summary: If this is a type parameter of a reduced extension method, gets the type parameter definition that this type parameter was reduced from. Otherwise, returns Nothing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeSymbol.TypeKind
member.summary: An enumerated value that identifies whether this type is an array, pointer, enum, and so on.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeSymbol.BaseType
member.summary: The declared base type of this type, or null. The object type, interface types, and pointer types do not have a base type. The base type of a type parameter is its effective base class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeSymbol.Interfaces
member.summary: Gets the set of interfaces that this type directly implements. This set does not include interfaces that are base interfaces of directly implemented interfaces. This does include the interfaces declared as constraints on type parameters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeSymbol.AllInterfaces
member.summary: The list of all interfaces of which this type is a declared subtype, excluding this type itself. This includes all declared base interfaces, all declared base interfaces of base types, and all declared base interfaces of those results (recursively). This also is the effective interface set of a type parameter. Each result appears exactly once in the list. This list is topologically sorted by the inheritance relationship: if interface type A extends interface type B, then A precedes B in the list. This is not quite the same as "all interfaces of which this type is a proper subtype" because it does not take into account variance: AllInterfaces for IEnumerable<string> will not include IEnumerable<object>;

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeSymbol.IsReferenceType
member.summary: True if this type is known to be a reference type. It is never the case that and both return true. However, for an unconstrained type parameter, and will both return false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeSymbol.IsValueType
member.summary: True if this type is known to be a value type. It is never the case that and both return true. However, for an unconstrained type parameter, and will both return false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeSymbol.IsAnonymousType
member.summary: Is this a symbol for an anonymous type (including anonymous VB delegate).

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeSymbol.OriginalDefinition
member.summary: The original definition of this symbol. If this symbol is constructed from another symbol by type substitution then gets the original symbol as it was defined in source or metadata.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeSymbol.SpecialType
member.summary: An enumerated value that identifies certain 'special' types such as . Returns if the type is not special.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeSymbol.FindImplementationForInterfaceMember(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol)
member.summary: Returns the corresponding symbol in this type or a base type that implements interfaceMember (either implicitly or explicitly), or null if no such symbol exists (which might be either because this type doesn't implement the container of interfaceMember, or this type doesn't supply a member that successfully implements interfaceMember).
member.param: Must be a non-null interface property, method, or event.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.LanguageNames
member.summary: A class that provides constants for common language names.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.LineDirectiveMap`1
member.summary: The LineDirectiveMap is created to enable translating positions, using the #line directives in a file. The basic implementation creates an ordered array of line mapping entries, one for each #line directive in the file (plus one at the beginning). If the file has no directives, then the array has just one element in in. To map line numbers, a binary search of the mapping entries is done and nearest line mapping is applied.

member.summary: Determines whether the position is considered to be hidden from the debugger or not.

member.summary: Combines TranslateSpan and IsHiddenPosition to not search the entries twice when emitting sequence points

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.LineDirectiveMap`1.HasAnyHiddenRegions
member.summary: Are there any hidden regions in the map?
member.returns: True if there's at least one hidden region in the map.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.LineDirectiveMap`1.PositionState.Unknown
member.summary: Used in VB when the position is not hidden, but it's not known yet that there is a (nonempty) #ExternalSource following.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.LineDirectiveMap`1.PositionState.Unmapped
member.summary: Used in C# for spans outside of #line directives

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.LineDirectiveMap`1.PositionState.Remapped
member.summary: Used in C# for spans inside of "#line linenumber" directive

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.LineDirectiveMap`1.PositionState.RemappedAfterUnknown
member.summary: Used in VB for spans inside of a "#ExternalSource" directive that followed an unknown span

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.LineDirectiveMap`1.PositionState.RemappedAfterHidden
member.summary: Used in VB for spans inside of a "#ExternalSource" directive that followed a hidden span

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.LineDirectiveMap`1.PositionState.Hidden
member.summary: Used in C# and VB for spans that are inside of #line hidden (C#) or outside of #ExternalSource (VB) directives

member.summary: The line is located before any #line directive and there is at least one #line directive present in this syntax tree. This enum value is used for C# only to enable the consumer to define how to interpret the lines before the first line directive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.LineVisibility.Hidden
member.summary: The line is following a #line hidden directive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.LineVisibility.Visible
member.summary: The line is following a #line default directive or a #line directive with at least a line number. If there is no line directive at all, Visible is returned for all lines.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxNode.GetCachedSlot(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a node at given node index without forcing its creation. If node was not created it would return null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxNode.GetChildPosition(System.Int32)
member.summary: This function calculates the offset of a child at given position. It is very common that some children to the left of the given index already know their positions so we first check if that is the case. In a worst case the cost is O(n), but it is not generally an issue because number of children in regular nodes is fixed and small. In a case where the number of children could be large (lists) this function is overridden with more efficient implementations.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxNode.GetDiagnostics
member.summary: Gets a list of all the diagnostics in the sub tree that has this node as its root. This method does not filter diagnostics based on #pragmas and compiler options like nowarn, warnaserror etc.

member.summary: Finds the node with the smallest that contains . is used to determine the behavior in case of a tie (i.e. a node having the same span as its parent). If is true, then it returns lowest descending node encompassing the given . Otherwise, it returns the outermost node encompassing the given .

member.exception: This exception is thrown if doesn't contain the given span.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxNode.CopyAnnotationsTo``1(``0)
member.summary: Copies all SyntaxAnnotations, if any, from this SyntaxNode instance and attaches them to a new instance based on .

remarks.para: If no annotations are copied, just returns .
It can also be used manually to preserve annotations in a more complex tree modification, even if the type of a node changes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxNode.IsEquivalentTo(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxNode,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines if two nodes are the same, disregarding trivia differences.
member.param: The node to compare against.

If true then the nodes are equivalent if the contained nodes and tokens declaring metadata visible symbolic information are equivalent, ignoring any differences of nodes inside method bodies or initializer expressions, otherwise all nodes and tokens must be equivalent.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxNode.IsEquivalentToCore(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxNode,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines if two nodes are the same, disregarding trivia differences.
member.param: The node to compare against.

If true then the nodes are equivalent if the contained nodes and tokens declaring metadata visible symbolic information are equivalent, ignoring any differences of nodes inside method bodies or initializer expressions, otherwise all nodes and tokens must be equivalent.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxTree
member.summary: The parsed representation of a source document.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxTree.FilePath
member.summary: The path of the source document file.
member.remarks:
If this syntax tree is not associated with a file, this value can be empty. The path shall not be null.
The file doesn't need to exist on disk. The path is opaque to the compiler. The only requirement on the path format is that the implementations of , and passed to the compilation that contains the tree understand it.
Clients must also not assume that the values of this property are unique within a Compilation.
The path is used as follows: - When debug information is emitted, this path is embedded in the debug information. - When resolving and normalizing relative paths in #r, #load, #line/#ExternalSource, #pragma checksum, #ExternalChecksum directives, XML doc comment include elements, etc.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxTree.WithChangedText(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Text.SourceText)
member.summary:
Create a new syntax tree based off this tree using a new source text.
If the new source text is a minor change from the current source text an incremental parse will occur reusing most of the current syntax tree internal data. Otherwise, a full parse will occur using the new source text.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxTree.GetDiagnostics(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxTrivia)
member.summary: Gets a list of all the diagnostics associated with the trivia. This method does not filter diagnostics based on #pragmas and compiler options like nowarn, warnaserror etc.

member.summary: Gets a list of all the diagnostics in either the sub tree that has the specified node as its root or associated with the token and its related trivia. This method does not filter diagnostics based on #pragmas and compiler options like nowarn, warnaserror etc.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxTree.GetLineSpan(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Text.TextSpan,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets the location in terms of path, line and column for a given span.
member.param: Span within the tree.
Cancallation token.
member.returns: A valid that contains path, line and column information. The values are not affected by line mapping directives (#line).

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxTree.GetMappedLineSpan(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Text.TextSpan,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets the location in terms of path, line and column after applying source line mapping directives (#line in C# or #ExternalSource in VB).
member.param: Span within the tree.
Cancallation token.
member.returns:
A valid that contains path, line and column information.
If the location path is mapped the resulting path is the path specified in the corresponding #line, otherwise it's .
A location path is considered mapped if the first #line directive that preceeds it and that either specifies an explicit file path or is #line default exists and specifies an explicit path.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxTree.GetLineVisibility(System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Returns the visibility for the line at the given position.
member.param: The position to check.
The cancellation token.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxTree.GetMappedLineSpanAndVisibility(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Text.TextSpan,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Gets a FileLinePositionSpan for a TextSpan and the information whether this span is considered to be hidden or not. FileLinePositionSpans are used primarily for diagnostics and source locations. This method combines a call to GetLineSpan and IsHiddenPosition.
member.param: Returns a boolean indicating whether this span is considered hidden or not.
member.remarks: This function is being called only in the context of sequence point creation and therefore interprets the LineVisibility accordingly (BeforeFirstRemappingDirective -> Visible).

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxTree.GetDisplayPath(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Text.TextSpan,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SourceReferenceResolver)
member.summary: Returns a path for particular location in source that is presented to the user.
member.remarks:
Used for implementation of or for embedding source paths in error messages.
Unlike Dev12 we do account for #line and #ExternalSource directives when determining value for .

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxTree.GetDisplayLineNumber(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Text.TextSpan)
member.summary: Returns a line number for particular location in source that is presented to the user.
member.remarks:
Used for implementation of or for embedding source line numbers in error messages.
Unlike Dev12 we do account for #line and #ExternalSource directives when determining value for .

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxTree.IsEquivalentTo(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxTree,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines if two trees are the same, disregarding trivia differences.
member.param: The tree to compare against.

If true then the trees are equivalent if the contained nodes and tokens declaring metadata visible symbolic information are equivalent, ignoring any differences of nodes inside method bodies or initializer expressions, otherwise all nodes and tokens must be equivalent.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.CallingConvention
member.summary: Specifies how the caller passes parameters to the callee and who cleans up the stack.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.CallingConvention.C
member.summary: C/C++ style calling convention for unmanaged methods. The call stack is cleaned up by the caller, which makes this convention suitable for calling methods that accept extra arguments.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.CallingConvention.Default
member.summary: The convention for calling managed methods with a fixed number of arguments.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.CallingConvention.ExtraArguments
member.summary: The convention for calling managed methods that accept extra arguments.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.CallingConvention.FastCall
member.summary: Arguments are passed in registers when possible. This calling convention is not yet supported.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.CallingConvention.Standard
member.summary: Win32 API calling convention for calling unmanaged methods via PlatformInvoke. The call stack is cleaned up by the callee.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.CallingConvention.ThisCall
member.summary: C++ member unmanaged method (non-vararg) calling convention. The callee cleans the stack and the this pointer is pushed on the stack last.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.CallingConvention.Generic
member.summary: The convention for calling a generic method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.CallingConvention.HasThis
member.summary: The convention for calling an instance method with an implicit this parameter (the method does not have an explicit parameter definition for this).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.CallingConvention.ExplicitThis
member.summary: The convention for calling an instance method that explicitly declares its first parameter to correspond to the this instance.

member.summary: An object that represents a local variable or constant.

member.summary: Custom modifiers associated with local variable definition.

member.summary: True if the value referenced by the local must not be moved by the actions of the garbage collector.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ILocalDefinition.IsReference
member.summary: True if the local contains a managed pointer (for example a reference to a local variable or a reference to a field of an object).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ILocalDefinition.IsDynamic
member.summary: True if the local variable is of type Dynamic.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ILocalDefinition.PdbAttributes
member.summary: Each local has an attributes field in the PDB. To match the native compiler, we emit "1" for locals that should definitely not bind in the debugger and "0" for all other locals.
member.remarks:
A value of "1" is a sufficient, but not a necessary, condition for hiding the local in the debugger. Locals with value "0" may also be hidden.
Hidden locals must still be emitted because they participate in evaluation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ILocalDefinition.DynamicTransformFlags

member.summary: Location for reporting diagnostics about the local.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody.CustomDebugInfoKind
member.summary: The PDB content for custom debug information is different between Visual Basic and CSharp. E.g. CS always includes a CustomMetadata Header (MD2) that contains the namespace scope counts, where as VB only outputs namespace imports into the namespace scopes. CS defines forwards in that header, VB includes them into the scopes list. This enum is used to distinguish which style to pick while writing the PDB information.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody.HasDynamicLocalVariables
member.summary: Returns true if there is atleast one dynamic local within the MethodBody

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody.LocalScopes
member.summary: Returns zero or more local (block) scopes into which the CLR IL operations in the given method body is organized.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody.NamespaceScopes
member.summary: Returns zero or more namespace scopes into which the namespace type containing the given method body has been nested. These scopes determine how simple names are looked up inside the method body. There is a separate scope for each dotted component in the namespace type name. For istance namespace type x.y.z will have two namespace scopes, the first is for the x and the second is for the y.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody.IteratorScopes
member.summary: Returns zero or more local (block) scopes, each defining an IL range in which an iterator local is defined. The scopes are returned for the MoveNext method of the object returned by the iterator method. The index of the scope corresponds to the index of the local. Specifically local scope i corresponds to the local stored in a field named <localName>5__i of the class used to store the local values in between calls to MoveNext, where localName is the original name of the local variable. For example, if the first local to be moved into the class is named "xyzzy", it will be stored in a field named "<xyzzy>5__1", and the ILocalScope returned from this method at index 1 (i.e. the second one) will have the scope information for where that variable is in scope.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody.IteratorClassName
member.summary: If the body was written as an iterator, returns the name of the (nested) type that implements the iterator's state machine.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.CustomDebugInfoKind
member.summary: This enum is used to distinguish which style to pick while writing the PDB information.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition
member.summary: This interface models the metadata representation of a method.

member.summary: A container for a list of IL instructions providing the implementation (if any) of this method.
member.remarks: When emitting metadata-only assemblies this returns null even if returns true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.GenericParameters
member.summary: If the method is generic then this list contains the type parameters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsImplicitlyDeclared
member.summary: Returns true if this symbol was automatically created by the compiler, and does not have an explicit corresponding source code declaration.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.HasDeclarativeSecurity
member.summary: True if this method has a non empty collection of SecurityAttributes or the System.Security.SuppressUnmanagedCodeSecurityAttribute.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsAbstract
member.summary: True if the method does not provide an implementation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsAccessCheckedOnOverride
member.summary: True if the method can only be overridden when it is also accessible.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsConstructor
member.summary: True if the method is a constructor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsExternal
member.summary: True if the method has an external implementation (i.e. not supplied by this definition).
member.remarks: If the method is not external and not abstract it has to provide an IL body.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsHiddenBySignature
member.summary: True if this method is hidden if a derived type declares a method with the same name and signature. If false, any method with the same name hides this method. This flag is ignored by the runtime and is only used by compilers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsNewSlot
member.summary: The method always gets a new slot in the virtual method table. This means the method will hide (not override) a base type method with the same name and signature.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsPlatformInvoke
member.summary: True if the method is implemented via the invocation of an underlying platform method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsRuntimeSpecial
member.summary: True if the method gets special treatment from the runtime. For example, it might be a constructor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsSealed
member.summary: True if the method may not be overridden.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsSpecialName
member.summary: True if the method is special in some way for tools. For example, it might be a property getter or setter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsStatic
member.summary: True if the method does not require an instance of its declaring type as its first argument.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.IsVirtual
member.summary: True if the method may be overridden (or if it is an override).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.GetImplementationAttributes(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Emit.EmitContext)
member.summary: Implementation flags.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.Parameters
member.summary: The parameters forming part of this signature.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.PlatformInvokeData
member.summary: Detailed information about the PInvoke stub. Identifies which method to call, which module has the method and the calling convention among other things.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.RequiresSecurityObject
member.summary: True if the method calls another method containing security code. If this flag is set, the method should have System.Security.DynamicSecurityMethodAttribute present in its list of custom attributes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition.ReturnValueAttributes

member.summary: The event that has been specialized to obtain this event. When the containing type is an instance of type which is itself a specialized member (i.e. it is a nested type of a generic type instance), then the unspecialized member refers to a member from the unspecialized containing type. (I.e. the unspecialized member always corresponds to a definition that is not obtained via specialization.)

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ISpecializedFieldReference

member.summary: A reference to the field definition that has been specialized to obtain the field definition referred to by this field reference. When the containing type of the referenced specialized field definition is itself a specialized nested type of a generic type instance, then the unspecialized field reference refers to the corresponding field definition from the unspecialized containing type definition. (I.e. the unspecialized field reference always refers to a field definition that is not obtained via specialization.)

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ISpecializedMethodReference
member.summary: Represents reference specialized method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ISpecializedMethodReference.UnspecializedVersion

When the containing type of the referenced specialized method definition is itself a specialized nested type of a generic type instance, then the unspecialized method reference refers to the corresponding method definition from the unspecialized containing type definition. (I.e. the unspecialized method reference always refers to a method definition that is not obtained via specialization.)

(I.e. the unspecialized member always corresponds to a definition that is not obtained via specialization.)

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.SecurityAttribute
member.summary: A declarative specification of a security action applied to a set of permissions. Used by the CLR loader to enforce security restrictions. Each security attribute represents a serialized permission or permission set for a specified security action. The union of the security attributes with identical security action, define the permission set to which the security action applies.

member.summary: An argument string (cookie) passed to the custom marshaller at run time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMarshallingInformation.ElementType

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMarshallingInformation.UnmanagedType
member.summary: The unmanaged type to which the managed type will be marshalled. This can be be UnmanagedType.CustomMarshaler, in which case the unmanaged type is decided at runtime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMarshallingInformation.NumberOfElements
member.summary: The number of elements in the fixed size portion of the unmanaged array. -1 if it should be omitted from the marshal blob.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMarshallingInformation.ParamIndex
member.summary: The zero based index of the parameter in the unmanaged method that contains the number of elements in the variable portion of unmanaged array. If -1, the variable portion is of size zero, or the caller conveys the size of the variable portion of the array to the unmanaged method in some other way.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.IMarshallingInformation.SafeArrayElementSubtype
member.summary: The type to which the variant values of all elements of the safe array must belong. See also SafeArrayElementUserDefinedSubtype. (The element type of a safe array is VARIANT. The "sub type" specifies the value of all of the tag fields (vt) of the element values. ) -1 if it should be omitted from the marshal blob.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.IMarshallingInformation.GetSafeArrayElementUserDefinedSubtype(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Emit.EmitContext)
member.summary: A reference to the user defined type to which the variant values of all elements of the safe array must belong. (The element type of a safe array is VARIANT. The tag fields will all be either VT_DISPATCH or VT_UNKNOWN or VT_RECORD. The "user defined sub type" specifies the type of value the ppdispVal/ppunkVal/pvRecord fields of the element values may point to.)

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.PeWriter.NameLengthLimit
member.summary: This is the maximum length of a type or member name in metadata, assuming the name is in UTF-8 format and not (yet) null-terminated.
member.remarks:
Source names may have to be shorter still to accommodate mangling. Used for event names, field names, property names, field names, method def names, member ref names, type def (full) names, type ref (full) names, exported type (full) names, parameter names, manifest resource names, and unmanaged method names (ImplMap table).
See CLI Part II, section 22.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.PeWriter.PathLengthLimit
member.summary: This is the maximum length of a path in metadata, assuming the path is in UTF-8 format and not (yet) null-terminated.
member.remarks:
Used for file names, module names, and module ref names.
See CLI Part II, section 22.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.PeWriter.PdbLengthLimit
member.summary: This is the maximum length of a string in the PDB, assuming it is in UTF-8 format and not (yet) null-terminated.
member.remarks: Used for import strings, locals, and local constants.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.PeWriter.StringIdx

member.summary: Fills in stringIndexMap with data from stringIndex and write to stringWriter. Releases stringIndex as the stringTable is sealed after this point.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.PeWriter.SuffixSort
member.summary: Sorts strings such that a string is followed immediately by all strings that are a suffix of it.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeWriter.WriteDeterministicGuidAndTimestamps(System.IO.Stream,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Compute a deterministic Guid and timestamp based on the contents of the stream, and replace the 16 zero bytes at the given position and one or two 4-byte values with that computed Guid and timestamp.
member.param: Stream of data
Position in the stream of 16 zero bytes to be replaced by a Guid
Position in the stream of four zero bytes to be replaced by a timestamp
Position in the stream of four zero bytes to be replaced by a timestamp, or 0 if there is no second timestamp to be replaced

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeWriter.ComputeSerializedGuidFromData(System.IO.Stream,System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: Compute a random-looking but deterministic Guid from a hash of the stream's data, and produce a "timestamp" from the remaining bits.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeWriter.GetDefiningUnitReference(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Emit.EmitContext)
member.summary: Returns a reference to the unit that defines the given referenced type. If the referenced type is a structural type, such as a pointer or a generic type instance, then the result is null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeWriter.GetStringIndexForNamespaceAndCheckLength(Microsoft.Cci.INamespaceTypeReference,System.String)
member.summary: The Microsoft CLR requires that {namespace} + "." + {name} fit in MAX_CLASS_NAME (even though the name and namespace are stored separately in the Microsoft implementation). Note that the namespace name of a nested type is always blank (since comes from the container).
member.param: We're trying to add the containing namespace of this type to the string heap.
Namespace names are never used on their own - this is the type that is adding the namespace name. Used only for length checking.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeWriter.IsTooLongInternal(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Test the given name to see if it fits in metadata.
member.param: String to test (non-null).
Max length for name. (Expected to be at least 5.)
member.returns: True if the name is too long.
member.remarks: Internal for test purposes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.PeWriter.AssemblyReferenceComparer
member.summary: Compares quality of assembly references to achieve unique rows in AssemblyRef table. Metadata spec: "The AssemblyRef table shall contain no duplicates (where duplicate rows are deemd to be those having the same MajorVersion, MinorVersion, BuildNumber, RevisionNumber, PublicKeyOrToken, Name, and Culture)".

member.summary: Serialize the method local signature to the blob.
